Course Home

Relativism

The Knowledge Argument

  • Required reading
    • ‘Theaetetus’, Plato, please read pp.186–206, i.e., the first 20 pages of the selection I have photocopied. Of course, you can read all of it if you would like.
  • Optional reading
    • Plato on Knowledge in the Theaetetus, SEP entry
    • Plato: Theaetetus, IEP entry
    • Plato’s Theaetetus, David Bostock, use the table of contents to pick the parts you would like to read.
  • Lecture notes

The Essence Argument

  • Required reading
    • ‘Metaphysics’, Aristotle, book 4. Do your best!
    • ‘Routledge Philosophy Guidebook to Aristotle and the Metaphysics’, V. Politis, ch.5-6. This starts at p.122. I include the whole book, but you only need to read these two chapters.
  • Optional reading
    • Aristotle on Non-Contradiction, Paula Gottlieb, SEP
    • Aristotle’s Metaphysics, S. Marc Cohen, SEP
